column4: does anyone know the apt-get-name of the qt opengl extension, I just can't find it
I find tons of python gl stuff, mesa packages etc and installed some of them
how can I do that ikonia
I tried aptitude search
but it even existed on suse ikonia o.O
yea I know, but I thought ubuntu would have the package if suse does
as ubuntu seems to have a bigger package base
have you enabled universe?
system -> administration -> software sources
there's nothing like universe
it's the second checkbox on the first tab:  "Community-maintained Open Source software (universe)"
apt-cache search qt opengl    turns up a bunch of packages here
what do you mean by "deactivate" exactly?
system -> administration -> services  tell gdm not to start
then read 'man update-rc.d' or install sysv-rc-conf and use that
I need something like setting the init level to 3
no, because 2-5 are the same on ubuntu.  Why do you want to do this?
yes
you could keep this very easy answer for the next guy asking :)
the man page for update-rc.d explains that
fair enough :)
there are pitivi and kino as well
dpkg -L PACKAGE | grep bin   may get you closer
